basics.name: J-Anne Yow
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

education.area: Research focus: Human-robot interaction for assistive robotics.

work.name: Rehabilitation Research Institute of Singapore, Nanyang Technological University
work.summary: Spearheaded the Robot-Assisted Feeding project, focusing on developing personalized assistive feeding systems. Mentored undergraduate students on final year projects. Assisted in preparing funding proposals to support the project.

work.name: ByteDance, Singapore
work.summary: Supported sales operations by conducting data analysis for SaaS products. Built dashboards, improved data integrity, and analyzed product-market fit for the Lark APAC team.
highlights: Built dashboards for the Lark APAC team to enable them to make data-driven decisions
Improved data hygiene and data integrity on Salesforce.com and ensured new tracking metrics were adopted by the teams across the region
Analysed and monitored DAU trends of tenants and their health scores to understand our product-market fit for a go-to-market plan

work.name: Oishii
work.summary: Oversaw a project integrating farm systems and forecasting infrastructure needs for de-risking operations in the world's largest indoor strawberry vertical farm. Collaborated with contractors to solve infrastructure limitations and automate farm operations.
highlights: Oversaw a project which involved integrating farm systems and forecasting future infrastructure requirements to de-risk current operations.
Coordinated and collaborated with contractors of different expertise to integrate systems and solve current infrastructure limitations.
Evaluated and built communication pathways of sensors and actuators inside the world's largest indoor strawberry vertical farms to automate the farm.

projects.name: Robot-Assisted Feeding
highlights: Implementing an end-to-end pipeline for robot-assisted feeding, including bite selection, bite acquisition with a spoon, and bite transfer.
Developed a framework for personalized assistive feeding, capable of adjusting robot actions such as modifying bite size based on language corrections.
Developing a goal-conditioned scooping policy to scoop a target amount of food while considering different food properties.

publications.name: ExTraCT - Explainable Trajectory Corrections for language-based human-robot interaction using Textual feature descriptions
Shared Autonomy of a Robotic Manipulator for Grasping under Human Intent Uncertainty using POMDPs
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

awards.title: Dr Leung Shiu Kee Gold Medal Award
awards.awarder: School of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering, NTU
awards.summary: Awarded to an outstanding final year student with a distinguished academic and extra-curricular record, and excellence in the 'MA4079 Final Year Project'.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.awarder: School of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering, NTU

awards.title: ASEAN Scholarship
awards.awarder: Ministry of Education, Singapore and Nanyang Technological University, Singapore
awards.summary: Awarded for secondary school, pre-university and undergraduate studies.
